columns.id: A unique identifier for each architect in the database.
columns.name: The full name of the architect.
columns.nationality: The national identity or country of origin of the architect.

architect.table_description: The architect table stores information about architects, including their unique identifiers, names, nationalities, and genders.

columns.architect_id: Identifies the architect associated with the bridge, linking to the architect's database.
columns.id: A unique identifier for each bridge entry in the database.
columns.name: The official name of the bridge, often reflecting its design or geographical significance.
columns.location: The geographical location where the bridge is situated, providing contextual information.
columns.length_meters: The length of the bridge measured in meters, representing its size.
columns.length_feet: The length of the bridge measured in feet, providing an alternative size representation.

bridge.table_description: The bridge table stores information about various bridges, including their names, locations, lengths, and associated architects, enabling detailed analysis and insights into bridge architecture worldwide.

columns.architect_id: Identifies the architect associated with the mill.
columns.id: Unique identifier for each mill entry in the table.
columns.location: Indicates the geographical location of the mill.
columns.name: Represents the name of the mill.
columns.type: Describes the style or category of the mill.
columns.built_year: Specifies the year the mill was constructed.
columns.notes: Contains additional information or remarks about the mill.

mill.table_description: The mill table stores data about various mills, including their architects, locations, names, types, construction years, and any additional notes.
